title: Essex firm to unveil world’s first launch hub for flying taxis
text:
A British firm is set to build the world’s first hub for electric aircraft in Singapore in a move that could propel global ambitions for flying taxis.

Skyports, an Essex-based company, is preparing to open its vertical take-off and landing station at the city-state’s Marina Bay later this month when industry executives will gather for a conference on transport technologies of the future.

The so-called “vertiport” will open in partnership with Volocopter, a German firm that has built an electric, vertical lift-off aircraft that will undertake a demonstration flight at Skyports’ Singapore hub.

Flying taxis have been touted as a potential alternative to helicopters for air travel in urban spaces,...
